## y=x^2

- parent parabola
- vertex=(0,0)
- axis of symmetry = x=0
- minimum value = 0
- domain = all reals
- range = all reals \geq 0
- increasing (0,\infty)
- decreasing (-\infty,0)
- zeroes
	- x=0
	- x=0
- y-intercept = 0

### y=(x+1)^2

- vertex=(-1,0)
- axis of symmetry = x=-1
- minimum value = 0
- domain = all reals
- range = all reals \geq 0
- increasing (-1,\infty)
- decreasing (-\infty,-1)
- zeroes
	- -1
	- -1
- y-intercept = 1

### y=-(x-4)^{2}+1

- vertex=(4,1)
- axis of symmetry = x=4
- maximum value = 1
- domain = all reals
- range = (-\infty,1)
- increasing (-\infty,4)
- decreasing (4\infty)
- zeroes
	- x=3
	- x=5
- y-intercept = -15

### y=x^{2}+12x-8

- vertex = (-b/2a,f(-b/2a))

- minimum value = -44
- domain = all reals
- range = (-\infty,-8)

- decreasing = (-\infty,-6)

	- 6 \pm 2 \sqrt{1}

### y=x^{2}+4x-5

- vertex = (-2,-9)
- line of symmetry = x=-2
- minimum value = -9
- domain = all reals
- range = (-9,\infty)
- increasing = (-2,\infty)
- decreasing = (-\infty,-2)
- zeroes
	- -5
	- 1
- y-intercept = (0,-5)
